item.title: Coronavirus, Discovered in the 1960s, Serious Respiratory Tract Infections
item.description: Coronaviruses are a group of viruses that cause diseases in mammals and birds that include diarrhea in cows and pigs, and upper respiratory disease in chickens. In humans, the virus causes respiratory infections, which are often mild, but in rare cases are potentially lethal. There are no vaccines or antiviral drugs that are approved for prevention or treatment.
item.dc:creator: Karthik Kumar D K
